labels.analysis: The MCP Server is specialized for managing and automating configurations of F5 Network devices, particularly through the iControl REST API. Its core functionality involves creating, updating, listing, and deleting objects such as virtual servers, pools, iRules, and profiles on F5 devices. The tools provided enable detailed interaction with F5's device management capabilities, making it suitable for network administrators and DevOps teams who need to programmatically manage their F5 infrastructure.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality aligns closely with network device management and automation, particularly with F5 devices. While it involves API integration and automation, it is more specifically focused on F5 device operations rather than general automation or API tasks. Thus, the primary label "Network Device Management" is most appropriate. Secondary labels such as "API Integration" and "Automation Tools" complement this by highlighting the technical methods used to achieve the device management goals.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: F5 Device Management Server
server_info_crawled.author: @czirakim/F5.MCP.server
server_info_crawled.overview: Manage and automate F5 device configurations using a tool-based API that interacts with F5's iControl REST API. Perform operations such as creating, updating, listing, and deleting virtual servers, pools, iRules, and profiles seamlessly. Enhance your workflow with an extensible, environment-configured MCP server compatible with various client integrations.

tools.name: show_stats_tool
tools.description: Deploy Server F5 Device Management Server Claim Server @czirakim/F5.MCP.server Try in Playground show_stats_tool

tools.name: show_logs_tool
tools.description: This tool shows the lines_number of logs from an F5 device using the iControl REST API. Args: lines_number is the number of lines to be returned.

tools.name: list_tool
tools.description: This tool lists object on an F5 device using the iControl REST API. Args: object_name is the name of the object. object_type can be : virtual,pool,irule or profile

tools.name: create_tool
tools.description: This tool creates an object on an F5 device using the iControl REST API. Args: url_body contains the configuration of the pool. object_type can be : virtual,pool,irule or profile The configuration of the object is the body for an POST request.

tools.name: update_tool
tools.description: This tool updates an object on an F5 device using the iControl REST API. Args: url_body contains the configuration of the pool. object_type can be : virtual,pool,irule or profile object_name is the name of the object. The configuration of the object is the body for an PATCH request.

tools.name: delete_tool
tools.description: This tool updates an object on an F5 device using the iControl REST API. Args: object_type can be : virtual,pool,irule or profile object_name is the name of the object. The configuration of the pool is the body for an DELETE request.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@czirakim/F5.MCP.server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
